To the chief Musician<S>5329</S> upon Neginah<S>5058</S>, A Psalm of David<S>1732</S>. Hear<S>8085</S> my cry<S>7440</S>, O God<S>430</S>; attend<S>7181</S> unto my prayer<S>8605</S>.
From the end<S>7097</S> of the earth<S>776</S> will I cry<S>7121</S> unto thee, when my heart<S>3820</S> is overwhelmed<S>5848</S>: lead<S>5148</S> me to the rock<S>6697</S> that is higher<S>7311</S> than I.
For thou hast been a shelter<S>4268</S> for me, and a strong<S>5797</S> tower<S>4026</S> from<S>6440</S> the enemy<S>341</S>.
I will abide<S>1481</S> in thy tabernacle<S>168</S> for ever<S>5769</S>: I will trust<S>2620</S> in the covert<S>5643</S> of thy wings<S>3671</S>. Selah<S>5542</S>. <sup>trust: or, make my refuge</sup>
For thou, O God<S>430</S>, hast heard<S>8085</S> my vows<S>5088</S>: thou hast given<S>5414</S> me the heritage<S>3425</S> of those that fear<S>3373</S> thy name<S>8034</S>.
Thou wilt prolong<S>3254</S> the king's<S>4428</S> life<S>3117</S> <S>3117</S>: and his years<S>8141</S> as many<S>1755</S> generations<S>1755</S>. <sup>Thou: Heb. Thou shalt add days to the days of the king</sup> <sup>as: Heb. as generation and generation</sup>
He shall abide<S>3427</S> before<S>6440</S> God<S>430</S> for ever<S>5769</S>: O prepare<S>4487</S> mercy<S>2617</S> and truth<S>571</S>, which may preserve<S>5341</S> him.
So will I sing<S>2167</S> praise unto thy name<S>8034</S> for ever<S>5703</S>, that I may daily<S>3117</S> <S>3117</S> perform<S>7999</S> my vows<S>5088</S>.
